snippet: The state did not violate the United States Constitution when it imposed new ballot access limits last year on minor political parties, a federal judge ruled Monday.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge Michael Watson rejects argument that Ohio violated United States Constitution by imposing more stringent ballot access criteria on minor political priorities in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The state did not violate the United States Constitution when it imposed new ballot access limits last year on minor political parties, a federal judge ruled Monday.

headline.main: Ohio: Judge Rejects a Challenge to Ballot Access Law
headline.print_headline: Ohio: Judge Rejects a Challenge to Ballot Access Law
